title: Apology to cabogirl1234
When your Husband isn't Spiritually Leading with Tasha Calvert
description:
Welcome back to the HowtoFaithaLife podcast! Today we have Tasha Calvert on to share her wisdom with us on all things spiritual leadership. I get the question often, "what do I do if my husband isn't spiritually leading the family? Do I keep learning and growing?" So when Tasha shared her experience discipling women with this issue I knew I had to have her on the podcast! It's a rich, convicting episode wether this is an issue in your marriage or not! I pray it blesses you abundantly!

title: 17 Harsh Truths I Wish I Learned as a Baby Christian
description:
Today I share 17 lessons I've learned later than I would have liked in my Christian walk. Now, obviously all of this advice is nuanced and could totally be twisted (do I sound scarred? I've had my words twisted too many times!) but I trust this video will help exactly those whom it is meant for! If you're a Christian pursuing growth in the Lord, I pray this video encourages you and helps answer some questions you may have had along the way.
If you are a seasoned Christian who has something to add to this list, PLEASE add it in the comments below! I am sure there's so much more to add to this list!

Order my book here: https://a.co/d/7qB7xiH

description:
Textual Criticism is a hot topic online lately after the Joe Rogan and Wes Huff podcast blew up the Christian side of the internet. It seems like everyone is talking about textual criticism but no scholars are sharing first hand about their work... except Dan Wallace. He's welcomed us into his home and shares today everything from the ordering of the Biblical Canon, how he catalogues manuscripts, and the reliability of those manuscripts.
#bible #textualcriticism #biblicalmanuscripts

Join me in supporting CSNTM, the Center for the study of New Testament Manuscripts here: https://new.csntm.org/hey-bible-nerds-youre-invited/ 
NOTE that the link works better on desktop, but if you are on your phone, flip it sideways and the form should be more readable.
From WHOMEVER joins from my link to support the ministry of CSNTM, I will draw on 3/1/2025 FOUR names to win a signed copy of the NET Bible. title: THE BEST BIBLE RESOURCE BY FAR!
description:
Check out these Bible Study Cliff Notes Here: https://howtofaithalife.samcart.com/products/cliffnotes
And take your Bible Studies to the next level! 

I have been working on something for over a year. It's a document that gives you "cliff notes" for every book of the Bible. The stuff you NEED to know to study it and REALLY understand it.
I was sick of books that are supposed to give you that information just not being enough.

They'd either be too intellectual, too boring, too simple, or not really enhance my Bible study. So I took those resources, my seminary notes, hundreds of hours, and made my Bible Cliff Notes!

I am so proud of this thing.
But also kinda sick of staring at them computer screen. (it's nice that they are done, I'm going to be honest!) All that to say, I can finally say:
THEY ARE HERE!
I've poured my heart and soul into these things, obsessing over what you need to know and what you don't need to know. I obsessed over what is the best advice for Bible studying the book and how to make it less overwhelming. I've made these with a heart for you.
Check out my cliff notes to every book of the Bible here and never be lost in reading the Bible ever again!
BTW: snag them before the end of the year, because in the new year they will go up in price!
I pray these bless you, because I KNOW they will transform your Bible study.
See you there: https://howtofaithalife.samcart.com/products/cliffnotes

title: My Christian Tiktok Went Viral- Atheists Attacked Me
description:

title: I Cut Open a She Reads Truth Bible & Glued it in My Journaling Bible...
description:
I cut open a She Reads Truth Bible and glued the notes into my journaling Bible and it might be the best Bible journaling idea I've had yet! Bible note taking (or stealing!) seems like such a weird or wrong Bible study notes idea, but let me explain... 
The She reads truth Bible has notes before each book of the Bible.... that is what I cut out- so that I could have these quick access guides and notes in MY journaling Bible! And I kept the scriptures in the She Reads Truth Bible completely unharmed and intact, so it's still a read-able Bible! I would NEVER harm the scriptures or disrespect them by cutting the scriptures out of a Bible...after all, that's my goal and aim in this and in my channel as a whole: to equip and encourage you to live a life of faith, so if you want to do some Bible studies with me and fan that fire of the faith, check out this playlist: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLeMpDclT-2HtigIQhzdugO3R_LNQzZVZc

title: How to Interpret the Bible CORRECTLY: exegesis & hermeneutics
description:
How to interpret and understand the Bible correctly: through exegesis and hermeneutics! Understanding the Bible and interpreting it correctly can seem overwhelming and like a huge impossible task with some passages of scripture, which is why today I will define exegesis and explain hermeneutics and we will talk about what roles they play in understanding the meaning of the Bible and what the text is actually saying. How we study the Bible really effects how we live out and obey the Bible, so using and understanding exegesis and hermeneutics is critical! LET'S DIVE IN!

title: SCRIPTURE WRITING? Why & How you need to scripture journal in ur Prayer Journal or Bible Journal
description:
Scripture writing is the simplest way to completely transform your Bible study life. By simply writing scripture in your prayer journal or Bible journal you can find a new joy & appreciation for the scriptures and go in-depth studying the Bible by scripture writing! Whether it's in a scripture journal(a specific journal just for writing the Word), Bible journal(writing the scriptures in your Bible, itself), prayer journal(pray/writing the scriptures) or war binder(making it a part of your daily prayer/Bible study life)- I suggest you try it today!

title: ((super in-depth!)) JOHN 3:16 REAL MEANING EXPLAINED - BIBLE JOURNAL WITH ME
description:
Today's in-depth bible study is on John 3:16 and we will discuss the meaning and explain the context/themes/purpose all as we bible journal! So grab your bible, pens, and get excited because I can pretty much guarantee you haven't heard some of these things before! 
I am a strong believer in the power of studying the context of a biblical passage. Like, the context of what was happening, the literary styles used, the book's purpose and themes, etc. These things add SO MUCH depth to the bible study and that's what I focus on today. Too often we've memorized John 3:16 or really want our kids to memorize it, but we don't know the context, ourselves! And if we don't know the context, they how do we know that we aren't taking it OUT of context?! Today's video we look at just that: the context, story, themes behind John 3, what was going on in the conversation with Nicodemus and what we are supposed to see in this passage that we just might miss!

title: ((what's a virtuous woman?! )) BIBLE JOURNAL WITH ME Proverbs 31 women's daily devotional
description:
What is a virtuous woman? What is Proverbs 31 about? Today, bible journal with me Proverbs 31 in a women's daily devotional, talking about wisdom, Godliness, and womanhood.
In today's bible study with me, we are talking all about the proverbs 31 woman and the wisdom personified here. I mention that this could be a literal woman, too- but that there needs to be an acknowledgment that we couldn't possibly do everything that this woman does EVERY SINGLE DAY. This impossible standard of the woman in proverbs 31 is one that should send us to our knees- true wisdom is running to the Lord to be our everything.
We also look at this chapter in light of the book of proverbs as a whole- doing an in-depth bible study means you look at the context and the themes of the book! And that is what we do today. My prayers is not that you just learn a lot from this women's daily devotional, but that you also benefit from it and grow in faith. After all, my channel, How to Faith a Life isn't just called that because my name is Faith. My channel exists to equip and encourage you to live a life of faith!

title: HOW I STUDY MY BIBLE: inductively bible journal with me Psalm 23
description:
How I study the bible inductively while bible journaling is the topic for today! We'll be in Psalm 23 so grab your bibles, separate yourself from distractions and let's dive into today's bible study!
In today's bible study method, I inductively work through Psalm 23 while bible journaling. This is what I do when I am just doing a morning bible study on my own and not really preparing for a lesson or video. So, I still go in-depth but I am more trying to relate and grow on a personal level and therefore get less researchy.... I think y'all know what I mean!
If you're interested in seeing more about how I bible journal or more in-depth bible studies from me, make sure you're subscribed and check out this bible journaling playlist: 
https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLeMpDclT-2HvXp7zJ1MHXNv6pGqyMue8b

Let me know what you'd add to this bible study or what stuck out to you while you were bible journaling with me! The cool thing about bible journaling is it all adds upon itself, so certain words may stick out to me this time, but next time when I come back to it, I may notice something new, which gives a new perspective to my previous notes, which just adds to what I am learning, and it's all because I have those bible journaling notes in my bible to read and reread and build off! 
Now, I feel the need to note that just because this is how I study my bible, doesn't mean that you need to also study your bible exactly this way, this is just how my brain works and what works for encouraging MY heart!

title: PRAYER JOURNAL FLIP THROUGH: prayer journal for future husband with lots of prayer journal ideas!
description:
Prayer Journal flip through and get all kinds of prayer journal ideas from my prayer journal to my husband spanning from 2003-2016! This is one of my favorite things I did in my life that actually was very therapeutic through those hard days, waiting for my man! So, I am going to walk you through it and hopefully give you LOTS of prayer journal ideas on praying for your future husband. I hope you enjoy reading journals written to future husband and wife videos- because this one is very humorous and embarassing!
Now, if you've been here a while, you may already know this, but my husband was my first boyfriend and first kiss. I was SUPER intentional about not dating in high school, just because I wanted to set that time aside to bible study more and grow closer to God. Then, when I was ready to date, I was VERY intentional about WHO I'd date. When I finally let go and dated someone, it turned out to be my husband and now we're married for four years! 
In today's video I flip through with you my prayer journal to my husband and share all kinds of prayer journal ideas to start a prayer journal to your future husband, and the parts of my prayer journal that were the most therapeutic. 
If you like prayer journal videos and videos that give you ideas for your prayer journal diy stuff, then definitely check out this video:
https://youtu.be/Pc8EyavHwhM
My prayer is this prayer journal flip through will inspire you to start a prayer journal for your future husband and get you excited for praying for him, in general! These prayer journal ideas are very practical with an emphasis on making it be what you need it to be- because I definitely think theres an emphasis on surrendering in your prayer journal for future husband. Praying for your future husband or praying for your future spouse can be so healthy and so helpful! Reading journals written to future husband and wife can always be so helpful but also a little cringe-y, so I tried to laugh at myself and only share out of my journal what you guys needed! 

If you'd like to see more about how to prayer journal or prayer journaling, I'd be happy to share more, just let me know down in the comments! And if you are new to How to Faith a life, this is my bible study, christian mom motivation, bible journaling channel! So everything pertaining to Christian womanhood and bible study stuff can be found here- so make sure you subscribe and let me know in the comments if you are new here! My channel exists to help Christian women enhance their bible study lives and personal lives through seeing the depth and beauty in scripture and its transformative power on our lives, homes, and families. Check out my personal instagram at: @mrsfaithwomack

title: BIBLICAL HERMENEUTICS?! How to Read the Bible Faithfully.
description:
Biblical hermeneutics and how to read the bible faithfully is the topic today- biblical hermeneutics is the interpretation of the bible. We look at the most used and abused verse in all of the bible. I bible study this passage and we talk about why people misuse it and how to have a faithful and biblical hermetical approach. This video is part of my series on how to read the bible where we look at all the different approaches and things that feed into our approach of the bible. Today's video looks at good hermeneutics and a hermeneutics bible study. We sit in Phillippians 4 and talk about the #1 thing that people miss when reading it. title: THE STORY ABOUT HOW WE GOT OUR BIBLE: shocking truths of bible canonization
description:
The story about how we got our Bible is today's topic. Today we are talking about the process of Bible canonization and how we got our bible! We will talk all about the canon of the bible made simple and yet still talk about more complicated things like textual criticism, just SIMPLIFIED! I share basics like what is bible canonicity and I really truly wanted to add as much value as possible, while providing a succinct, short, video! 
As I mentioned, we are sharing the story about how we got our bible, so I share about the process of copying texts and translating texts and even textual criticism! BUT, all the while keeping it simple- the canon of the bible made simple! It is really important to me to share the canon of the bible made simple. I know first hand how overwhelming it can be, especially with scary questions about the process so that's why it's so important to me to share the canon made simple.  
Let me know if you have any question about the story about how we got our bible, I may not know everything about bible canonization, but I do know people who do! I hope this video just gives you a general understanding, for your own bible study life, about how to read the bible and interpret it, and interact with it knowing how it has been preserved for you! 
Leave me a comment and a thumbs up if this video on the story about how we got our bible and bible canonicity has added any value to your bible study life, and I will see you on Friday looking at a bible study on probably the most used and abused bible verse in the bible!

title: HOW TO READ THE BIBLE LITERARY STYLES CORRECTLY: how to read the bible faithfully!
description:
How to read the bible literary styles correctly boils down to how to read the bible faithfully, if we are being honest! Today we're talking about how to read the bible's literary styles- everything from prophesies, wisdom, poetry, etc! 
One of the craziest parts that I love about this video is that like NO ONE talks about this stuff, it seems like. And, that's why scripture is always being misused, because it was written for one thing, but is being used for another! So in today's video, as we talk about how to read the bible literary styles correctly- remind yourself that it's okay if you've done it wrong your whole life and it's okay if you have heard it used the wrong way behind the pulpit- we are ALL learning! All of us! So, we need to approach all of this with humility as we talk about the various types of literature in the bible and trust God is glorified in our attempts at faithfulness in how to read the bible! I hope this video in how to read the bible's literary styles blesses you and encourages you in your walk with the Lord, and sends you running to His Word! 
But, nonetheless, I pray that this video feeds your hunger and thirst for God's Word and gets you diving deep into the scriptures as we talk about how to read the bible faithfully!
If you're new here to this channel, How to Faith a life is my place on the internet where I like to share all things bible study and this series is about how to read the bible faithfully and appropriately! I am a mom of two, pastors wife, and full time seminary student so I have a lot going on in my crazy world, but I love every bit of it! Join me for the ride and hit subscribe! 
Instagram: @mrsfaithwomack
#howtoreadthebible #howtofaithalife #jesusformommies


Father God, use this video on how to read the bible literary styles to bless someone out there- just at least one person- who is looking to learn and grow in their knowledge about how to read the bible's literary styles and how to read the bible faithfully. All glory goes to You, God- able to use SUCH a sinner like me. May I be used for Your glory and this video for Your glory! Thank You for seminary and schooling to teach me how to read the bible literary styles, and I pray that all I learn about the bible's literature and how to read the bible, is shared faithfully and selflessly to bless others. Thank You for Youtube, where I can share about how to read the bible's literary styles for free! God, you are SO GOOD. Be honored in my life!

title: HOW TO READ THE OLD TESTAMENT - Covenant Theology (Reformed Theology), How to Read the Bible
description:
Hey friends! Today we are going to talk about how to read the Old Testament with eyes looking for Jesus- using Covenant theology. This reformed theology is transformative in how to read the bible and I am so excited to dive in! 
But first, this video, about how to read the old testament, is part of my "How to Read the Bible" series- in this series I seek to de-mystify some common questions in how to read the bible and just make it all as simple as possible! So if this is something you'd be interested in, make sure to hit the subscribe button and let me know in the comments if there's anything you'd like to hear about! I'd be happy to make a video and answer any questions! 
If this video helps you, will you let Youtube know by giving it a "thumbs up"? That's just a really simple way to help other's find my videos on how to read the bible! 
In today's video on how to read the bible, we are talking specifically about how to read the Old Testament through the lens of Covenant Theology. Reformed theology finds Covenant theology to be a core factor in why we read the Old Testament. So, when we talk about how to read the old testament I want you to keep in mind that this is also just how to read the bible and not just the Old Testament! Covenant theology is so very crucial to seeing Jesus in the entire Bible narrative! Reformed Theology tells us that Christ is in it all! 
So today, I share an Old Testament overview and an Old Testament timeline to kind of point out the big parts where we see Jesus and a need for Jesus, other than the prophets. It is crucial in your old testament bible reading to know how to study the bible through the lens of Covenant theology or else there is so much that will be missed! So that is also why I wanted to address this earlier on in my how to read the bible series, is how to read the Old Testament in a Christ-centered way. Frankly, if we don't use Covenant theology, then there really isn't much point to read the Old Testament! I can see  why people might ask, "why read the old testament?"! So, maybe you're asking, should a christian read the old testament, and I'd say a BIG YES! In fact, I'd say a big part of Covenant theology is knowing how to read the bible and thus seeing the old testament simplified- with the lens of seeing Christ! I hope this old testament timeline and old testament overview encourage you to jump into God's Word and dig deep!
Because, Christ is there! It's not, "should Christians read the Old Testament"? It's DO Christians read the Old Testament and see Christ, because that's what we are supposed to see, in the old testament simplified!
And hopefully this video gets you motivated as I share how do I read the old testament to make you want to jump into the Old Testament scriptures TODAY! Read through the Old testament not because I say you should, but because God has given you a desire to! 
Let me know in the comments if you have any leftover questions after this old testament explained overview. I tried to present an old testament simplified old testament overview, but there's no telling if I actually made Covenant theology simple! That's why I love y'alls feedback!
Make sure to check out the rest of this playlist and my other videos here on how to faith a life- I'd love to answer any questions you may have about Covenant theology and reformed theology, and I will see y'all on Friday! 
Instagram: @mrsfaithwomack
#howtoreadthebible #howtoreadtheoldtestament #covenanttheology

In this particular video about how to not get bored in your daily bible study, I share practical tips on how to read the "boring" parts of the bible and how I manage to read the bible all day long, study the bible in seminary, teach my children the bible, and assist my husband in ministry with the bible, without getting bored of the bible. A big part of how to read the scriptures is how to read the "boring" parts of the bible and seeing their purpose and usefulness. In fact, I would argue that we don't truly know how to read the bible if we are consistently getting bored in our daily bible study. So, today I talk about how to not get bored in your daily bible study and how to read the boring parts of the bible through four simple, practical steps that you can apply to your bible study today and see a huge transformation! I pray this video inspires and motivates you to dive deep in your daily devotional and that your daily bible study 2020 is transformed by these steps! 
If you are interested in more videos about how to in-depth study the bible or how to read the bible, check out the rest of the videos in this playlist! And give this video a thumbs up if it motivated you or taught you anything! 
Reading the bible doesn't have to be boring! This needs to be your why to read the bible, the "why" to daily devotions.

title: PRAYER JOURNAL FLIP THROUGH: How to start prayer journal, DIY prayer journal & prayer journal ideas
description:
Today we are talking all about my prayer journals! We talk about how to start a prayer journal, how to make a DIY prayer journal, prayer journaling for beginners and just general prayer journal ideas. So if you are excited about this prayer journaling video, give it a thumbs up! 

This video is in collaboration with Amanda from Staying Kingdom Minded, which can be found here:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCF6Cxt1qH5-FRrc5X3FyV3A
And her collab prayer journal video can be found here:

https://youtu.be/3SjeewxlY2A

If you have ever tried prayer journaling before, you'll know there's no set way on how to make a prayer journal or how to start a prayer journal. & that's my first piece of advice on prayer journaling for beginners. If you have watched other prayer journal flip through videos, you'll know that no two prayer journals are the same. I hope in this video, you'll know that what I share when I talk about how to start a prayer journal & when I share prayer journaling ideas for beginners, that it's not THE ONLY WAY to prayer journal, but that I am just sharing prayer journal ideas. 
Another thing to note is that in this prayer journal flip through I share some readings from past prayer journals and some things I am doing in my prayer journal right now, but that doesn't mean that my prayer journal is perfect or like holy or anything. I share all this DIY prayer journal stuff to share prayer journal ideas. To inspire you if you're wondering how to start a prayer journal. 
If you're trying to learn how to prayer journal or how to start a prayer journal, then this is the video for you. I share lots of prayer journal ideas, how to prayer journal in general, how to prayer journal, etc. You can even watch me prayer journal for prayer journal ideas! I even share my favorite cheap place to find prayer journal supplies to prayer journal cheaply! 
Because they are so similar, I also talk a lot about bible journaling and my bible journal. If you like my watch me bible journal videos, then you'll like this watch me prayer journal video. And if you'd like, feel free to prayer journal with me! At the end of this video I share a prayer journaling idea that you can do RIGHT NOW. But basically, this video is supposed to provide inspiration for you to start your prayer binder or war binder TODAY, just go talk to Jesus! There's no rules on how to pray- just pray! If you're looking up how to prayer journal for beginners- here is your answer: just start writing out your prayers! There's really not much more to prayer journaling!
Ultimately, I think the key to prayer journaling and how to make or how to start a prayer journal, is just starting. Just writing. It won't be perfect, it shouldn't be perfect, just write. Just pray. And there's no real system or set of rules on how to pray, you just PRAY!
If you like content like this one, consider subscribing to my channel, How to Faith a life. I am a christian youtuber and mom to two kids. I am a mom in seminary and a pastor's wife, too! I have been  prayer journaling and truly walking with the Lord for about 13-15 years. I love making these bible study with me videos, and have gotten really into bible journaling & prayer journaling! 
If you want more DIY prayer journal ideas, just subscirbe & there will definitely be more ideas that I share with you in my future bible journaling & bible study with me videos! 

Father God, use this prayer journal flip through to inspire someone learning how to prayer journal or someone searching about prayer journaling for beginners. Inspire them to start a war binder & use this video as motivation.

As I share all about prayer journaling for beginners, may You be glorified! If someone is creating a prayer binder or war binder, may they know that it's about You & not the crafts! 
If anyone is wondering how to pray or how to make a prayer journal, may they see that its nothing they do, its all about YOU. It's not about how to start a prayer journal, it's about just starting. May no one watching this prayer journal flip through compare themselves or their prayer journal to me, but rather be inspired with the prayer journal ideas I share. Be inspired to not only DIY prayer journal(you don't need expensive supplies!) but also to bible journal too!  May this prayer journal for beginners video inspire just one person to pursue You more, Lord! Amen.

title: PRODUCTIVE MOM MORNING ROUTINE: online student and stay at home mom in seminary grad school
description:
Today's video is a 4am productive mom morning routine of an online student and stay at home mom. In this grad school mom routine of a stay at home mom and online student, I show you how I get it all done- online school work & being a student mom, and all that is involved in my productive early morning routine. I hope this productive student mom morning routine inspires and encourages you that 4am isn't THAT scary!
Instagram: @mrsfaithwomack #studentmom #howtofaithalife #gradstudentmom
As an online student and stay at home mom, there is definitely enough time in my day to do grad school work, but that would mean no time spent with my two boys. So, I get up early in the morning and have my grad school mom routine, so that the majority of my online school work is done in the mornings during this productive mom morning routine. I think it is important to have a grad school mom routine if I am going to get most, if not all my grad school work done in the AM. THUS, a 4am morning routine. I love being a mom in seminary, but if I am not careful, I can easily loose track & forget what's important- my boys. That's why I am extremely thoughtful about the ways I spend my early morning routine. As an online student and stay at home mom, I need to live by check lists and my planner to make sure my morning routine is a PRODUCTIVE morning routine. As as a christian mom, I KNOW I need to seize the day! 
But, that doesn't mean I'm a workaholic! In my 4am morning routine I make sure there's time for me to take care of myself! I show you how I, as a Christian mom, get that time with Jesus in my christian mom morning routine. I also noticed that so many stay at home mom morning routines do not feed the soul & so I really try to emphasize that I need to start my mornings w/ Jesus. Also, it's important to note that as a christian mom & as a mom in seminary, it can be easy to get tired of all this bible related stuff, so I make sure I am enjoying & glorifying & worshiping Him FIRST before I start my student mom morning routine! 
What kind of morning routine do you have as a student mom? I really would love to hear about your christian mom morning routine or your grad school mom routine!
In this morning routine of a student mom video, I pray you are encouraged that your morning routine doesn't have to be this real elaborate thing. To be a productive mom with a productive morning routine 2020, all you need is the time that you get when you wake up for a early morning mom routine! So this morning routines 2020 online school edition is focused around staying awake & staying productive, because for me that's the key to a productive morning routine; just giving yourself that time & making sure you stay productive! 
Once the boys wake up my productive morning routine goes kind of wack b/c I have 2 kids two & under it's just crazy. Typically, I'll let them eat breakfast in their highchairs & we'll sing songs & giggle while I finish online grad school. I guess that's another tip of a online student and stay at home mom, to use eating time as productive mom time. But typically my true 4am productive mom morning routine ends when they wake up. I guess what I am trying to say is it is okay if your sahm routine isn't perfectly ROUTINE. 
If you are new here consider subscribing to how to faith a life & check out my other christian mom videos. I am a christian mom & grad student mom in seminary. I love making all kinds of bible study videos & I would love to have you subscribe if that's the kind of christian mom videos that you'd like! 

God, use this grad school mom routine to bless a discouraged christian mom out there that she can make a productive mom morning routine! Or a discouraged mom in seminary.  I pray when they see this 4am morning routine that they are encouraged if they are also a grad student mom. In this productive morning routine 2020 may someone see that if they want to be a mom in seminary, they can be. Encourage a christian mom to go to school through my grad school mom routine. I guess what I am praying is may this 4am mom morning routine bring You glory and honor You, Jesus! When people hear that I am a mom in seminary, don't let them get the wrong idea, that I am not 'holier than thou' but just like any other student mom grad student. May they be encouraged whether they have a 6am productive mom morning routine or a 4am mom morning routine. It's not about the time of day, it's about using a early morning routine to change the day into a productive mom morning routine if you're a grad student or if you're a stay at home mom. Father, use this early morning routine to encourage and motivate other christian moms that they can make productive morning routines for Your glory to better serve their families and homes! May not anyone be intimidated by this christian mom productive morning routine, but encouraged. If someone is looking up christian mom morning routines, may they find this productive morning routine & be inspired!

title: CHRISTIAN MOM IN SEMINARY: mom of two in seminary grad school | young christian mom day in the life
description:
Welcome to a day in the life of a young christian mom in seminary! I'm learning to focus on intentional living now that I'm a mom of two in seminary grad school. Intentional living is so important because time has gotten rarer and more precious! I have to be intentional about every hour of the day! 

Every part of this day in the life is a great example of how I am focused on intentional living- thinking through how I can get everything done as a mom of two in seminary. I have to plan out house chores, youtube work, seminary lectures and readings and papers, and even plan out time to be a normal person. Being a young christian mom isn't easy, but it's so worth it. I love my life and I am focused on spending my days well and not 'wasting' a single one of them!
In this day in the life, I'll show you basically everything for a day, our morning run, nap routines, meal routines, chores, homework- all of it! We talk about the concept of intentional living and hopefully I give you a good representation of what a day in the life of a young christian mom looks like. We talk about intentionally living every hour to the glory of God and so that's why I am so focused on school and being present with my boys and marriage. Showing up for it all. 

But yeah, let's talk more about this mom in seminary thing- I recently started online seminary classes, and since I did an undergrad degree in Biblical and Theological studies, I was able to transfer credits, so I am jumping into it full force as a full time student and mom of two. I remember watching ditl of a college mom kind of stuff here on Youtube and always wondering how moms kept their sanity, so I tried to show you it all, today. A true, raw and real young christian mom day in the life! This isn't a college mom vlog where everything is nice and calm and orderly, my life is a mess just like everyone else's! But, I am loving this new challenge of being a mom of two in seminary. It's an awesome season of life, making me dial in, on what's important and necessary and what's not! I re-evaluating how I spend my time and how I show up as a grad student mom in the classroom and in the house. I don't have to get straight A's. That's just not necessary. But I am called to be a faithful mom. And that's what I focus on when I am trying to evaluate my life and time with eyes focused on intentional living. As a mom of two in grad school, I don't need netflix and facebook, I need Jesus and I want a nap and coffee! haha. 

I pray that this mom ditl encourages and motivates you that you got this day, whatever lies ahead of you in your own life. I am a big believer that we all need more young christian mom encouragement, and I pray that this video did just that for you! 

If you are also a young christian mom, especially a mom of two in grad school, or a student mom or a mom in seminary, please please please comment down below! I WOULD LOVE more student mom friends! And let me know if you also make ditl graudate student kind of videos because I would love to watch your videos and glean wisdom from the way you do life and make it all happen. 

If you are new here, welcome to how to faith a life! My name is faith and I have this channel, #howtofaithalife . Consider subscribing, liking and sharing! 

Father, use this video about my life as a grad student mom to encourage other student moms out there. Especially women in seminary who are afraid that they can't do it all or think that they are all alone. Use this video to encourage other young christian moms to pursue intentional living and not waste a day of their lives away with mindless living. While people are scrolling youtube and looking at college mom vlogs, I pray for future friends to find my video, so that we can connect and become internet friends! 

May this mom ditl video not make anyone feel inadequate in any way, but motivate and just provide young christian mom encouragement for student moms or christian moms. If anyone is considering becoming a women in seminary, may this video motivate and encourage them that they can do it! We need more people to be that awkward female in seminary and change the perception that seminary is just for pastors! 

And I pray for that grad student mom who is tired and weary and feels defeated. She may never watch this video, only scroll by, meet her with YOURSELF. Heal, empower, motivate and rejuvenate her in You... the well of living water, where we will drink and thirst no more. 

May this ditl student mom show a realistic, not perfect take and encourage any insecure moms out there, that no one's life is perfect. And that we all need Jesus and He is the safe rock we can run to and find refuge! 

Father, use this video, a silly ditl of a christian mom in seminary, to encourage someone. To send someone running to You that has been running from You. Use this video for Your glory, Your kingdom come and Your will be done!
#christianmom #jesusformommies

title: MY TESTIMONY OF SINGLENESS AND DATING | choosing singleness, christian dating, young christian mom
description:
Hey faithful friends! Welcome back to part two of my testimony and Q&A! Today's video I share my testimony of singleness and dating! I know in the christian dating world, singleness and dating are buzz words and everyone has preconceived notions about what each of those things feels like, but my job is just to share my testimony of how God protected my heart and gave me my answered prayers and now I am a young christian mom and so grateful I listened and followed! 

Singleness and dating are two of the hardest trials young Christians face in this day and age and I am not here to lay a hard a fast rule about how to handle that topic. But, I do want to share my testimony and story of how God provided abundantly above all I could ask or imagine in my experience of Christian dating. And I do share a little christian dating advice... but again, it should be handled differently for each person's situation! 

In high school, as a newer, young christian, I felt the call to choose christian singleness in order to focus more on my relationship with the Lord and I am so glad I did! Because it honestly saved me from a TON of heartbreak! I think that might be my number one single christian women advice, actually! No one says you HAVE to date right now. Relationships are hard and demanding and a wise woman knows when she can't handle one! 

I got married at a young age, and see all along the way how God provided and carried and called me to get married at 21. Now, fast forward 4 years later, and two kids later, I am a young christian mom who is SO GRATEFUL for where she is. Y'all know from watching my videos what it's like being married at 21 and my life post-marriage, but today I just wanted to share more details about how I got to be a young christian mom and christian dating testimonies. 

This video was stirred on by your questions about how I met my husband and I hope it is a more than sufficient answer! I also know a lot of people love watching how I met my husband christian testimonies and so I pray my story encourages someone out there! When you hear my how I met my husband christian stories, be encouraged that God is at work and turn and glorify Him! I want all glory to go to God that He provided an amazing husband and all along the way of saving myself for marriage. 

If you like videos like this one, consider subscribing to how to faith a life! I have a whole series for moms, if you're also a young christian mom! Check it out on my Jesus for mommies playlist! I make christian mom devotionals and bible study videos for really anyone! So make sure to subscribe if those are videos you want on your homepage! 

#christiandating #christiansingleness #christianmarriage

You can watch bible study videos all day long and listen to sermons all day long, but if you never pray to the Lord yourself, you haven't built a relationship with God, but rather a study of God. title: CHRISTIAN REGRETS?! || God's word for today & scripture for today on regrets || Today's bible verse
description:
Hey faithful few! Welcome to a video today where we explore God's word for today on Christian regrets and what it means to regret something you've done, when you're a Christian. A really popular idea is to live life with no regrets. In today's bible verse, we uncover why that's not really a biblical idea. This idea, to live your life with so much pride in yourself and your choices that you don't regret anything, isn't biblical at all! In this video, exploring Gods word for today, we see that when we look at Christian regrets with a Biblical lens, today's scripture makes it clear that we should regret our sin. Today's bible verse show us that we should loathe and hate sin! This video looks at scripture for today and hopefully will motivate you to run to the cross, run to Jesus as our only hope and life. 

I hope you enjoy this video, where I share some bible scripture for today. If you like videos like this one, I'd encourage you to hit the like button and comment down below what you'd want the next video to be about! I think I might do more bible verse for today videos, where I share a daily bible verse and some commentary on it. I have been thinking about daily videos for a while, now. Today's bible reading talks about a lot of grace and gospel and if those are some things you don't know much about, I'd encourage you to comment below and ask someone, even me! 

It should also be noted: this womens daily devotional video should not replace today's bible reading that you do on your own. But rather, should just add to it! My videos will never be able to replace a personal relationship with Jesus Christ! God's word for today needs to be prayed and meditated on in private, one on one with God, not just consumed off Youtube! So never let my videos or when I share God's word for today, replace anything you'd do on your own! 

Let me know in the comments your favorite verse and your favorite place to find a daily bible verse! And if this video of God's word for today to you about your own Christian regrets, sin, and brokenness has encouraged you, would you consider sharing this video with someone else? Maybe there's someone in your life that God has brought to mind that would benefit from this video! Consider sharing it, and I so appreciate it!  Today's bible reading can apply to all of us, because we are all such broken sinners. 

If you are new here, this is my channel, How to Faith a Life, and I make all sorts of womens daily devotional videos and daily bible devotions or Christian mom videos. So you should definitely check out my channel and all that's going on there! https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLeMpDclT-2HvYZVmW_KIh8387yydkkrNP

I hope this video does the same for you. If you struggle with having Christian regrets or the weight of your Christian regret bares down on you sometimes, this video is for you.
Father, I pray that this daily bible reading on Christian regrets and the words I say will do nothing but primarily give you glory. I pray for the one person who might see it, who is unsure about their faith and what they believe, give them all they need to be encouraged TOWARDS you today, through this video. I pray the word for today that is shared will only encourage and motivate people towards YOU, and nothing else. God, I am always so weary of coming off as preachy and sharing today's bible verse and some commentary naturally was something I felt led to do, but now that I am posting it, I am scared and insecure and I know You know that, but I pray that this daily bible devotions series and all the videos that You lead me to make here will shout Your glory. You do with my channel what You want to do. May today's scripture be true to Your intent and Your glory. Lead me as I have a desire to do something like daily scripture reading or making daily bible devotions videos. I am not sure what to do with this desire, but lead me even in this video, sharing today's bible verse. I am not sure what quite to do! But, nonetheless, You get the glory! May any daily scripture reading videos that I do get up, only do that: bring You all the glory! Today's bible study talks about regret and Christian regrets- and I know that there will be very vulnerable hearts watching this video: turn their attention to You and Your saving work on the cross and towards repentance and us all receiving God's word for me today. May today's bible verse shared and scripture reading read only praise You and nothing of myself. Amen

title: TIRED MOM MOTIVATION- MOM MOTIVATIONAL VIDEO staying positive and motivated as a mom in quarantine
description:
Today I just wanted to provide us with some mom motivation for all those moms struggling with staying positive and motivated as a mom in quarantine. If you're a tired mom who is struggling to get her daily shower in, or a depressed stay at home mom fighting the baby blues, this season of quarantine and staying home to avoid the pandemic is effecting us all! That's why I wanted to make this tired mom motivation to encourage us to run to Jesus. 

I don't think there are enough mom motivational videos out there, to truly encourage moms in the fight, to wake up and give more of themselves and surrender more of their time for the benefit of others, and we need that motivation! But I would be wrong to encourage us to get up and give give give, if I don't first encourage us to make sure we are fueled by Jesus! In this covid mom motivation video, I encourage mommies to run to Jesus, before they run to take a shower, or paint their nails and all the other self care things we think will SAVE US. 

If you want to see more videos like these motivational mom videos let me know! I sure enjoyed making it! I myself could use some more motivational stay at home mom videos in my own life! Let me know if there's a topic you'd like me to cover in a motivational video for moms and I'd be happy to do it! I think we so often spend all our time talking about why moms are miserable, or how hard motherhood is, and we forget to actually provide motivation for tired moms to run to Jesus, the only drink that will satisfy our thirsts and longings. If you can't tell, I'm pretty passionate about motivational stay at home mom videos! And pointing people to Jesus as the way of how to be a happy sahm. True stay at home mom motivation can only be found in Jesus. There's cleaning mom motivation and mom motivation for parenting and mom motivation for organizing but there's no truer motivation for moms than the cross. So, in this video of motivation for tired moms, pointing moms to scripture, I pray that moms will be motivated to run to the Word and to call out to Jesus in their struggles. I think this is one of the main reasons why moms are miserable, because we spend all our time reminding moms to take a shower or do something for themselves, instead of reminding moms that they need Jesus! 

So, if you hear nothing from this mom motivational speech, hear this: run to Jesus. Father God, use this encouragement for moms during quarantine to reach the tired, depressed, weary moms who need more of You, not another cleaning motivation video. Now is such a time when we need pandemic motivation for moms, provide that for us. And you get the glory when we find that staying positive and motivated as a mom really looks like running to You and finding You to be all we need! Thank You God, for being our lives, for being our tired mom motivation. For being the source of life and the truth that I get to share in this mom motivational video. title: Postpartum Anger || Postpartum Rage || Postpartum Depression & Anxiety
description:
Hey faithful few, welcome back to another brutally honest video- today's is  about postpartum anger or what some call postpartum rage. 

This is something I haven't talked about here, but I have definitely dealt with it, and I think way more mothers struggle with it than we realize. It can look like an unusual amount of postpartum anger at husband or really anger filled postpartum depression, and it can often come alongside the symptoms of postpartum anxiety. So like, in the middle of a panic attack, or getting really angry after a panic attack. I think I wouldn't have noticed that I was dealing with anything out of the ordinary until I noticed that I tend to have an increase in postpartum anger at my husband, throughout postpartum seasons. And I hate myself for it! 

In fact, I would say a lot of my postpartum depression is ruled and reigned by postpartum anger. I am usually the most filled with postpartum rage WHEN I am also struggling the most with postpartum depression. So, today I share a few of my best tipd to overcome depression as a stay at home mom, in the midst of the anxiety and stress of dealing with two under two and the crazy that that brings. I talk about how to be a happy sahm whose life isn't ruled and reigned by postpartum rage. I talk about postpartum depression anger and what it looks like for me to fight it, like REALLY, HONESTLY. 

If you also struggle with this, I'd be interested FOR SURE on hearing about your experiences. How to be a happy sahm when your hormones only want to make you angry, postpartum rage how long does it last, and how you eventually got out of it. I think I am coming out of the woods, but I really want to take care of myself and not count on getting better unless I am sure about it. I hate the postpartum angry all the time feeling and I feel like it's coming up less and less, but I never want to get desensitized to my sin. 

Another thing I talk about is how so often my postpartum anger at husband is really postpartum angry at God. And making that distinction can be SO important. So often it seems like my husband can do nothing right, and I have it the hardest on planet earth, and my kids are trying to give me the hardest time possible.... and I get so angry at myself and my life and then I'M NOT ANGRY AT THEM OR ME. I am angry at God. But, I don't want to be angry at God! Then that leads me into thinking that nothings actually WRONG, because all these hardships are from God, Himself! So, He gave them to me because He made me and knows I can handle them, even though I don't feel like I can. And so, I am a firm believer that Christian mom postpartum depression is a much better term to describe all that's going on because postpartum depression is very different as a christian mom, than as somebody without a Savior. Even Christian mom postpartum anxiety is different, because in the midst of the panic attack, I have someone to call on, to calm the storm in my head. So, yeah.
Thank you for joining me today on this video about Christian mom postpartum anger. If you like content like this, I make all sorts of Christian mom videos and bible study videos here on How to Faith a Life.  Hit that subscribe button, and the bell so you're notified every Monday and Friday when I post, and comment down below that you subscribed so I can get to know you! 

Stay faithful!
Instagram: @mrsfaithwomack
#postpartumanger
#postpartumdepression
#postpartumanxiety

title: AM I TRULY SAVED? || how to know for sure if you are saved || ow to know for sure that you are saved
description:
Hey faithful few, welcome to a candid conversation about how to know for sure if you are saved. A lot of new believers ask the question of how to know if you're really saved, and we wanted to discuss that a little today because it's actually incredibly motivating to talk about and encouraging for most people! 

Caileys link:
https://youtu.be/vpf2e6V8WsM
Instagram: @mrsfaithwomack

There's so often this idea that maybe I need to walk down the aisle again, or man, I really messed up- how can I be saved and sin that bad?! And that's why we think it's so important to talk about the important topic of how do you know if you are truly saved. 

We see in scripture the answer to the question, "How Can I Tell If Iâ€™m Really Saved?" is simply answered with "fruit". Not the kind you eat, but spiritual fruit. You see, how to have assurance of your salvation really comes down to looking and seeing if we look like Jesus, that's how we know He's inside of us!
The christians assurance of salvation comes down to producing fruit much like a plant. We know a plant is dead or alive, if it keeps blooming, making fruit, and sprouting. It's the same way with believers! In fact, if we are not bearing fruit, we should ask the question, "am i truly saved?". We see that the Christian life isn't just about avoiding hell, and asking how to be sure you wont go to hell, but rather about being Christs, being little Christ's (the definition of Christian). You see, how to know if you're going to heaven comes down to if you're life is changed, if it is different... because it should be! So, if you are asking am i truly saved, maybe you need to ask yourself instead, am I any different by what I claim to have changed my life?
How to know youre going to heaven should come down to knowing that you have a relationship with God, because you are close like that! ;) Thats really how to know for sure that you are saved GUARANTEED. It's that close relationship, undeniable relationship!
How to know for sure if you are saved comes down to knowing for sure that He has changed you! I think so many people live with these questions of will i go to heaven or hell when i die and the answers are surprisingly simple when you look at scripture!
If you are new here, my name is Faith and this is my channel; How to Faith a Life! If you love watching bible study videos and Christian videos like this one, and if you enjoyed this discussion on how to know for sure if you are saved, then you just GOTTA hit the subscribe button! 

Father God, use this video, for Your glory! Amen.
#saved
#salvation
#heaven

title: Christian Mom Modesty: while breastfeeding? As a pastors wife?
description:
Hey faithful few! Welcome back to another Jesus for Mommies video, today's video is on Christian mom modesty! Now, the topic of christian modesty is definitely a hot topic and there is a lot of judgment around the topic, but I am all about acknowledging the differences of what is modest all over the world! Modesty simply is not simple! :) See what I did there?
Link to first video on modesty: https://youtu.be/5_FhGT667zg
Link to Staying Kingdom Minded's video: https://youtu.be/ln6Uj4RWdSk
More specifically, I talk about breastfeeding modesty. All about outfits that work for me to easily breastfeed while still staying modest. Modest Christian women all over the world right now are struggling with what to wear so that they have access to nursing their child, and this is something I definitely have stressed out about when I am pregnant, but both times I have been postpartum, these are the kind of clothes I ended up loving the most.
Again, if you haven't seen my first video on modesty, definitely go check that out, I talk more about what is modesty, biblical modesty, and how I practice modesty. Christianity modest women all kinds of start to sound legalistic and that's the last thing I want to be! Because the cross! Amen? Amen! In that video I talk about the importance of modest living, instead of just dressing modestly, having a modest heart, too.
In this video I show modest breastfeeding clothes, modest summer clothes, and just general modest fashion for summer 2020.
As a christian mom modest breastfeeding clothes are very important to me so my prayer is that this video gives you some good ideas on what you can wear, and still be modest! I just share a few modest nursing outfit ideas because I really truly don't own many clothes, and that's part of what I do to make my life easier, but also practice modest living. The modest breastfeeding outfits that I show and talk about are ones that have shirts with buttons all down the front, or are layered. I like even doing both those options when possible! And my favorite thing to look for in modest breastfeeding clothes are a hem line thats extra long so that it covers my bottom! Essentially, modest breastfeeding clothes don't have to be expensive clothes from those fancy breastfeeding clothing stores, they can be everyday shirts and clothes that are also very modest and super functional and cute! And modest summer clothes don't have to be super hot and sweaty, like my skorts, that are leggings material, the beauty of modest living in our day and age is that you can find nearly anything online!

These are my modest summer clothes and I just pray that these ideas encourage and inspire you!
Remember to check out all my videos in the Jesus for Mommies playlist and I'll see you in my next video!

description:
Welcome back to another Christian mom bible study on resting in Jesus! Today we talk all things about thee sabbath, and how I was convicted in my morning devotional to take a rest. So, this vloggy mom devotional on rest is meant to encourage, inspire and motivate you to rest in Jesus.

And then we jump into a morning devotional on on rest and we talk in this mom devotional about laziness verses the Sabbath commandment to rest and the differences as well as the faithful response. 

I love doing these kind of bible study for weary moms videos because I think way too often we think God doesn't care about our worn-out-tired-eyes and in all reality God called us to motherhood, so He will sustain us, but He also totally sympathizes and cares when we are overwhelmed and exhausted. So, that's why I made this bible study on resting in Jesus, to remind us of the call to take a Sabbath and the importance of that rest. In this Christian mom bible study we look at various different scriptures and emphasize our need for rest, because I think much too often moms are embarrassed to admit that they need rest! But, if there's any take away from this Christian mom bible study on rest, its that the call to rest is totally legitimate and if we try not to be, we are essentially just trying to be our own God. BOOM. Mike drop! Like, whattt? Yup, because we see in Genesis 2, THAT GOD RESTED. And if God almighty thought it was important to rest, needed rest, are we trying to be better than Him, by never needing rest? This Christian mom bible study on taking a sabbath should point us to faithful worship THROUGH resting in Jesus! 

If you are new here, this is my channel, How to Faith A Life, and I make all kinds of Christian mom morning devotional videos like this Christian mom bible study on resting in Jesus! title: WHEN LIFE GETS HARD | Overcoming Adversity - Inspirational & Motivational Video | never give up?
description:
When life gets hard, and we are trying to overcome adversity, we need inspiration and motivation that doesn't come from the world, that says to work harder, never give up, push deeper into yourself to find more to give, just keep pushing, just keep trying, no, when we are overcoming adversity, and when like gets hard, we need inspiration and motivation that comes from Jesus alone. We don't keep pushing, never give up, keep trying, keep fighting because of ourselves. The focus should never be on ourselves. The problem with dont give up christian motivation is that it makes it sound like its all on us not giving up, that we are saved and rescued or we succeed by not giving up, by ourselves pushing harder and let's be real, what's even any different about that than secular motivation?
The problem with girl go wash your face or girl get up christian faith motivation is that it's not about us getting up and washing our face. It's not about us not giving up when we are overcoming adversity. It's not about when life gets hard we push harder. No, Christians persevere because CHRIST PERSEVERED AFTER US. There's your powerful christian motivation in 2020! The best way to overcome adversity when life gets hard, to truly grip onto solid Christian motivation and Christian inspiration, is not to never give up, but it's to keep our eyes fixed on the cross! girl get up christian motivation should really be called girl LOOK UP! 

So we never give up BECAUSE God is with you in the battle, not because we watched some motivational video that said to never give up. We overcome adversity by resting in Christ! Resting in Christ! That's the powerful christian motivation 2020.
#nevergiveup
#christianmotivation
#inspirationalvideo

title: BIBLE STUDY TIPS: how to read the bible for beginners
description:
Bible study tips and how to read the bible for beginners- today I am sharing 2 things to NEVER DO in your Christian bible study.
Today we are talking about 2 things I always try NOT to do in my bible study time. These approaches can just lead to bad hermeneutics and applications to the Christian life, but are way too common in the church nowadays. Especially among younger Christians who are developing their approach to the Bible and how to read the bible for beginners. Today we are discussing two bible study tips that I apply to basically every Christian bible study lesson or devotional that I do, that kind of are based off of or feed off of "How to Read the Bible for all its Worth" by Fee and Stuart. 

It's so important as Christians, especially for new Christians learning how to read the bible for beginners, when we study our bibles, or approach the scriptures, to know what we are reading, like what type of literature it is and how it's supposed to be read, that's basic hermeneutics. But it's super important so that we don't misuse the scriptures or mis-interpret them! Thus, I wanted to share these basic bible study tips with y'all for your Christian bible study time or while leading Christian bible study lessons so that you know you are doing right by the scriptures. 
These two bible study tips are meant to inform you of not only how I study my bible, but also the basics of how to have your own in-depth bible study. 

How I study the bible is something I have had to learn, like a skill or discipline and so whenever I find something that's simple and sharable in a simple youtube bible study video, I think I will share it, because these are priceless skills for the Christian bible study. And priceless for beginners to learn, while studying how to read the bible for beginners. And they are crucial to how to read the bible for all its worth and how to read the bible effectively!
This is really important for young believers or newer Christians learning how to read the bible for beginners.

I pray these bible study tips inspire and encourage you to go dive deep into the scriptures and read "How to Read the Bible for All it's Worth". I pray that my caveat, that God is way bigger than our inabilities to do everything perfect or to read our bibles perfectly, encourages you that you don't have to be a master of the bible to taste and see that the Lord is good!
These bible study tips are just things to keep in mind in the future as you jump into God's word!
If you like content like this, or bible study lessons, Christian motivational videos, in-depth bible study videos, or any other how to read the bible videos; then hit that subscribe button because that's what we do over here at How to Faith a Life! But, I feel like I am rambling on, hit that subscribe button and leave your bible study tips down below and I will see you in Friday's bible study with me video through James!

title: OVERCOME ANXIETY ||christian inspirational and motivational video encouragement for women moms fear
description:
Welcome to another Christian inspirational and motivational video, here on How to Faith a Life! Today we are talking about overcoming anxiety, fear and worry and we even talk about idols, mental health, and all the rest! This series, on my channel, 'Jesus for da morning', is my new little series where I hope to provide encouragement and motivation amidst life's struggles with the truth of Christ and the hope of the gospel. So, if you like watching Christian encouragement that is inspirational and motivational, then hit that subscribe button! I am a Christian mom, so a lot of my videos approach those topics: anxiety, stress, and fear in women and moms. But I also make general Christian bible study videos and encouragement, so you don't have to be a Christian mom to subscribe!
But, I make Christian encouragement for moms, because I think there's a huge hole in Youtube, where there's only a few videos that provide mom motivation and encouragement, and MUCH LESS Christian motivation and encouragement for women. So, that's what I am here to do! I figured, if no one else is going to do it, I guess I will! 

I also have a whole series called Jesus for Mommies that are bible studies on topics for mothers, like this one here on anxiety. I want to inspire, encourage and motivate mothers to not live and parent by fear but by faith! 

So, subscribe to my channel for mom motivation or mom encouragement and to this series for christian inspirational/motivational videos! And watch this one to overcome anxiety stress and fear! One of the biggest struggles I think Christian women fight in this day and age is anxiety. They struggle with this because they have a hard time remembering their identity and their worth. Want to know why I think this? Because I LIVE it. I see in in my life, in the lives of the women in my family, and in the lives of the women in my church and friends. I SEE IT IN THE LIVES OF OUR GENERATION. So, today weâ€™re going to dive deep into the scriptures and do a hopefully motivational Christian bible study for women that reminds us of not just who we are, but WHOSE we are so that our anxieties can be met with the truth of Christ and cut through our anxiety with a double edged sword. You see, I want Christâ€™s truth to be the blood that runs though my veins. To be the air I breath in and breath out. I donâ€™t want to live my life claiming Christ but not letting Him permeate my entire being. I am nothing outside of Christ. NOTHING. I can spend all day on here, all day folding laundry, all day working out, but none of it does anything of real value if Godâ€™s not in it, because HE IS ALL THAT MATTERS IN THIS WORLD. Not what others think of me. Not my security or my comfortably, not even MY HEALTH and fitness. Nope, all these idols crumble to their knees at the name of Jesus Christ. So, where am I going with this? we established that anxiety and lack of identity are one of the top issues in Christian women in this day and age, we established that the lack of identity and the anxiety are usually empowered by idols. We established that all those idols donâ€™t compare to Christ, and crumble to their knees before the throne, and now I ASK THIS: DO YOU? Do you crumble before the throne of God and proclaim, â€œGod! I am a broken sinner, lost running after idols if it werenâ€™t for you, Iâ€™d be just as good as dead. You are my all in all, Father. And I say that but I DONâ€™T always live like that, help me believe it to my core. Father, BE my all in all. Be my life. I am tired of these struggles with anxiety and identity. I am tired of wasting my life away with worry and feeling lost in this world, not really knowing where I belong. And then Jesus responds, â€œI love you THIS MUCHâ€. And your immovable and unshakable identity is that you are my child. So no ones hate or critiques of you mean anything, because you're my daughter. So punch fear in the face! Overcome that anxiety stess and fear, not just with brute force, or something you could possibly muster up on your own, but with faith. FAITH OVER FEAR. Overcome anxiety with faith. That's the truth: I think all Christian encouragement for women can be summed up in this one principle, having more faith than fear. There's really no more inspiration for moms that's needed, most the time. Because so often women and moms, in particular, live their lives controlled by their fears, not their faith.
I hope this christian inspirational and motivational video about anxiety has been an encouragement to any of you moms out there, please comment down below and let me know, if that's the case! From one Christian mom to another: SEEK GOD! FAITH OVER FEAR! 

XOXO
stay faithful

description:

Hey welcome to Howtofaithalife, my name is Faith and this is THE space on Youtube for Christian motivation, in depth bible study lessons, Jesus morning motivation and Christian inspirational and motivational videos, like this one. As well as practical bible studies for the day to day real life, & if thatâ€™s something you think you need on ya feed, then hit that subscribe button! I also have a â€œJesus for Mommiesâ€ series here, for moms and a series on prayer. So, clearly weâ€™re all over the place in all the good things, diving into Gods word and watching Him sanctify us day by day. So hit that subscribe button for more Christian motivational videos in 2020!

OKAY, SOâ€¦. For our first Jesus morning motivation video for our series, "Jesus for da morning" I wanted to do the bible study on this idea that we need to: 
STOP BELIEVING IN YOURSELF. 
WHAT? What kind of Christian inspiration or motivation is this? YUP.
I want you to forget all those sports movies and all those pep talks you got in school and all those things your coaches have poured into you and remember this one thing: JESUS, will never fail you.
Because the truth is that if your faith is rooted in yourself, you will fail yourself. ITâ€™S INEVITABLE. Youâ€™re a human and you are weak, you need a nap every once in a while, you trip, you zone out- whatever it is: you ainâ€™t perfect. And if youâ€™re a millennial and grew up in the age of all the Disney movies, this idea of â€œbelieve in yourselfâ€ was so deeply rooted in us, its uncomfortable to truly think like this: like â€œI canâ€™t rely on myselfâ€ â€œI am going to fail myselfâ€ â€œI canâ€™t be trustedâ€ â€œIM A SINNER IN NEED OF A SAVIORâ€ BUT IS THAT NOT ALL TRUE? Do we not fail ourselves everyday?
We live in a time of human history where freedom and individualism and independence are SO overvalued that this idea of self-sustaining and â€œfind yourselfâ€ and go define yourself are so overvalued that we forget that thereâ€™s no such thing as complete independence! 

But I mean: Look at your bellybutton! Its physical proof that youâ€™re dependent on others, at the end of the day, if you just believe in yourself to make it through life, or hard things, youâ€™ll find that you fail yourself, youâ€™re not strong enough, your not powerful enough, and in the midst of an age thatâ€™s radically seeking self actualization and independence and freedom, youâ€™ll find more than ever that you need JESUS. You need someone thatâ€™s not bounded by the chains of sin and brokenness, you need someone else, to define you and set you free, because you canâ€™t do that. I've said this in a lot of my other bible study videos, but: You need your identity, your value your life rooted in believing in HIM, because thereâ€™s NOTHING to believe in yourself for! 

Itâ€™s like when Moses gave the Israelites the law and then in Debt 30 he said, this is life! Choose life! This is real living. This is real safety. 

Remember, we are called, as children of God, to not be true to ourselves, to do our desires, to go find ourselves, NO- ACTUALLY, in God we find that heâ€™s already given us an amazing identity, value, purpose in Him and a rock solid rock to build our faith off of, JESUS. So if you don't get anything else from this in depth bible study on NOT believing in yourself, get this: if we believe in ourselves, we are living a life where we have to work and keep up the work and never rest or we might fail, AND MIGHT NOT BE ENOUGH and just keep believing and hoping that we might have enoughâ€¦ NO! SET YOUR FAITH, SET YOUR SIGHTS ON THINGS ABOVE, ON WHAT CHRIST DID ON THE CROSS. COL 3:2 says, â€œSet your affection on things above, not on things on the earth. For you are dead and your life is hid with Christ in God.â€ It doesn't say, "set your sights on what you can do" or "believe in yourself enough and set your sights on yourself!"

So, you want Christian inspiration and motivation? Look at the cross. SET YOUR BELIEFS THERE, THE ROCK, THAT ALWAYS SATISFIES, THE ONE YOU CAN ALWAYS COUNT ON, AND WHERE NOTHING DEPENDS ON YOUR ABILITY TO BE ENOUGH. The best part about it? Itâ€™s already done. Jesus said, it is finished. And it has been finished, so set youâ€™re believe there. Stop believing in yourself and believe in the one who gives life, and life to the fullest.

Alright guys, make sure you hit the subscribe button with that little bell so you donâ€™t miss the next â€˜Jesus for da morningâ€™ video, I'm pumped to see what God has in store for 2020, full of Christian motivation and inspiration and Jesus morning motivation to start your day. And go check out my other in depth Christian bible study lesson videos, where we dive into topics like anxiety, prayer, fear, patience, etc. STAY FAITHFUL!

title: PATIENT IN TRIALS? || christian motivation to be patient bible study in depth Christian moms
description:
Hey friends! Welcome to an in-depth bible study lesson on patience, because even though we don't want it to be true, I think it's something MOST believers in our day and age need to learn and grow in! Hence, why I did this bible study lesson on patience! And I think we also all need christian motivation to be patient.

But first, Hey welcome to How to faith a life, my name is Faith and this is THE space on Youtube for Christian moms and REALLY anyone looking for Christian devotions for motivation and encouragement, as well as practical in depth bible study lessons for the day to day real life,  & if thatâ€™s something you think you need on your feed, then hit that subscribe button! I do this series here for Christian moms specifically, called Jesus for Mommies on Christian motherhood.
Now, last time I asked a question and I really enjoyed hearing back from yâ€™all because I feel like I really get to know yâ€™all better every time I hear back from you, so hereâ€™s another one: When is it hardest for you to exercise patience and what do you do to fight your sin nature and fight TO HAVE patience?
So today weâ€™re doing a in depth bible study lesson on patience & study for our christian motivation to be patient. If youâ€™re anything like me, you may know youâ€™re called to have more patience, but you donâ€™t want to have to have more patience and you donâ€™t really want to have to grow in your patience because patience is BORING AND EWHHHHH.
In our western society, patience is probably one of the least valued virtues, because we value speed and efficiency so highly. I have to confess, I lean towards valuing efficiency TOO much and it can be really bad. Especially for our christian motivation to have patience.
In this mother's online bible study video, I think itâ€™s really important for us to remember that time is different to God than it is for us. He can see all of time, He is outside of time and initiated and created time, and we are stuck, in this moment, only seeing whatâ€™s right in front of us. We canâ€™t see His plan, we canâ€™t see His intentions or where any of this random life stuff is going.
Be encouraged in your christian motivation to be patient, that He sees you, knows you, and HE SEES where this is all going and still calls you to be patient, right now, where youâ€™re at. Proverbs 3:5-6
Let me re-word that just to drive home this idea one more time: Our God, our good, good, Father, who sees everything of all time, knows where your situation is going and understands your desire and your temptation to be impatient, sees everything, initiates and holds everything together, and sees where itâ€™s going and doesnâ€™t stop and say, â€œoh, yeah, this is an exceptionally annoying situation, you go ahead and be impatient in this scenario.â€ No, He sees it all and still calls us to BE PATIENT. 
But, lets get real, does my faith DEPEND on me understanding why God is waiting? Do I only follow and obey and believe the Lord if/when it makes sense and I see where He is going with it all? Now, of course we all want to shout, â€œof course not!â€ â€œWe believe when we even canâ€™t see!â€ 
SO, get this: even when we canâ€™t bring ourselves to believe and to be patient, God is still good and loving because His character, His UNCHANGING character is outside of us believing in it. And ironically enough, doesn't that help your christian motivation to be patient?!
So, idk if any of that even made sense, or if I lost you, in this christian video on patience, but weâ€™re called to be patient because God looks at all eternity and He says, â€œyup, be patientâ€¦..â€ Use your desire to be impatient as fuel to seek His face.
Do you see what I am doing there? I think as Christian moms, doing a bible study, often times its easy for us to look over the fact that we have to see the divide: feeling verses knowing because thatâ€™s an important principle to this all: impatience is a feeling. But patience is an ACT. 
Now, I have to acknowledge, in this bible study on patience that in Genesis 29 we see Jacob exercise 14 years of patience. And of course, his patience is empowered by LOVE.
Ok guys, if this in-depth bible study lesson on patience has benefiting you in any way, I encourage you to pray about sharing it with someone who might benefit it (like another busy mom who might need to be met with a bible study on patience)and or giving it a like, and of course, hit that subscribe button if you already havenâ€™t and are interested in more christian video bible studies on patience, fear, anxiety and the like. I hope this video gave you some christian motivation to have patience. While I make a lot of bible studies for busy moms and women, many videos can easily apply to really anyone. I REALLY appreciate yâ€™all getting involved in the teaching and applying of this lesson, and commenting down below how YOU fight your sin nature and fight TO HAVE patience. I love yâ€™all so much, stay patient, and stay faithful!
