title: IN DEPTH BIBLE STUDY LESSON ON FEAR |small group mother's bible study bible study for busy moms
description:
Hey welcome to an in depth bible study lesson on fear here at Howtofaithalife, THE space on Youtube for Christian mommies and REALLY anyone looking for Christian bible study lessons for motivation and encouragement, any kind of bible study for busy christian moms, as well as practical in depth bible studies for the day to day real life, & if thatâ€™s something you think you need on ya feed, then hit that subscribe button!

So today weâ€™re talking and doing a in depth bible study lesson on fear, or really overcoming fear! This, christian mom bible study seeks to attack the very nature of our fears and habit of our worries.
I think as mommies, it is so easy for us to worry after our children and our spouse, We are the caretakers of the home, and I think WAY MORE OFTEN than we want to admit, we tell ourselves that we can care for the family by worrying for the family. but there's nothing farther from the truth about our fear. 
Here's the main verse for this christian mom devotional :
Romans 8:38-39 says, â€œAnd I am convinced that nothing can ever separate us from Godâ€™s love. Neither death nor life, neither angles nor demons, neither our fears for today nor our worries about tomorrow- not even the powers of hell can separate us from Godâ€™s love. No power in the sky above or in the earth below- indeed, NOTHING in all creation will ever be able to separate us from the love of God that is revealed in Christ Jesus our Lord.â€
I mean, letâ€™s even look at deathâ€¦ whatâ€™s the worst case senario? YOU MEET JESUS FACE TO FACE.  I don't mean for us to get all suicidal in this mother's bible study, but I want to encourage you, we truly have nothing to be anxious or fearful of!
But yeah, I mean, the reason we even need to do this bible study lesson on fear is BECAUSE we live in a scary world, we have a lot going on right now, the economy is crashing, there is so much going on and thereâ€™s a lot that lies ahead that we donâ€™t even know about. But, we can live in confidence, knowing that none of those things can take away Jesus. Nothing can take away our salvation. NOT EVEN satan himself. And you might be watching this mom bible study on anxiety and doubting me, but Psalm 46:1-3 says, â€œGod is our refugeÂ and strength,Â an ever-presentÂ helpÂ in trouble.Â Therefore we will not fear,Â though the earth give wayÂ and the mountains fallÂ into the heart of the sea,Â though its waters roarÂ and foamÂ and the mountains quakeÂ with their surging.â€ So we see that even if the earth falls into itself, we are safe in Christ.

Even more so, God uses this as the groundwork to command us not to fear: Isaiah 43:1 â€œDon't fear, for I have redeemed you; I have called you by name; you are Mine.â€ God actually commands us not to fear, or worry. So, not only do I encourage you in this bible study for busy moms to not worry, but also weâ€™re commanded to surrender our desires to worry, our desires to feel like we predicted every bad thing that will happen, our desires to control the situations or our life by worrying and figuring out a solution- God calls us to surrender that at the foot of the cross.

And I am going to take it one step further, because I am just THAT obnoxious, and this is an IN DEPTH bible study on overcoming fear, amiright?! But, not only are we commanded not to fear and worry 365 times in the Bible, not only has God got our â€œbillâ€, and made the sacrifice for our sins on the cross, not only can NOTHING separate us from the love that is in Christ Jesus our Lord, but when we know all this and still choose to live in fear and worry, we are spitting on the sacrifice done on the cross, saying, "I know you say it's enough to atone for my sins, and I know you say you've got this God, but I don't believe you've got it all. I need to worry just a little bit more. I need to try to control this a bit more and make sure it's really all taken care of."

But, don't leave this women's in depth bible study without hearing this: God is MORE THAN ENOUGH. He didnâ€™t just tell us â€œdonâ€™t fear honeyâ€, but he defeated all our fears. Let me say that again, HE DEFEATED ALL OUR FEARS. ALL OF THEM. And locked us in, safe with Him. Psalm 23:4 says.â€œEven though I walkÂ through the darkest valley,Â I will fear no evil,Â for you are with me;Â your rod and your staff,Â they comfort me.

So weâ€™re called to surrender our fears at the foot of the cross, and what do we find there? We find life to the fullest in Christ, a life that is not living in fear but set free in the cross. 

So instead of living with fears rule and reign in your life, live with the freedom, the life, the TRUTH OF CHRIST RULING IN YOUR HEART AND MIND this morning and for the rest of your life, after this women's morning devotional. Live like you actually believe what you say you believe. 
Okay, I hope this in depth bible study lesson on overcoming fear has been encouraging. Stay diligent in the faith, fight fear. And like I always say, stay faithful.

title: Winter Morning Routine 2020 with Jesus | DITL Christian Mom | SAHM of two under two
description:
Hey faithful few! This morning I share with you my winter morning routine for 2020. This is the schedule I follow to keep my sanity and get all that I need to get done for the day. I love my quiet time in the morning all alone with a cup of coffee! Basically, in this video I want to provide a good idea of the average DITL (or morning in the life!) for a Christian wife and mom that is a sahm (stay at home mom) of two under two. That's basically why I have had to adapt my morning routine and get up so much earlier, is that having 2 under 2 is just crazy during the day and I can't hardly get things done AND have quality time with my boys! So, here's my morning routine, starting at 5 am! Now, this is just my winter morning routine for 2020, hopefully by the spring our lives will be a little more put together and I can wake up a little later ;). Nonetheless, I hope this video provides you with some morning motivation to get up, pray and spend time with Jesus in a quiet time or bible study! After all, if Jesus really is our only hope and our lifeline, that should get us JUMPING up out of bed and into our bibles, right? I show you my bible study routine and share a few snippets of prayer lessons I have learned and advice for your prayer time and prayer journal-ing. As well as just a general idea of what my morning routine with Jesus looks like. I hope this DITL for my Christian morning routine is relatable and encouraging because I am honestly a bit insecure about how REAL I am in it, without makeup or even a normal outfit! But that's real life mom life! And it's my real and honest Christian mommy morning routine with Jesus. If you like this type of video, or if it gave you mommy inspiration in any way go ahead and subscribe and give this video a thumbs up! I would love to make more videos like this winter morning routine 2020.



If you're new here, I am a Christian mom youtuber, and a stay at home mom (sahm) of two under two! I love my two boys, I LOVE routines and organization and being frugal and crafty and most importantly, I love Jesus! Being a SAHM 2 under 2 isn't always easy so I focus on making videos that would encourage other moms like me, in Christian homemaking, motherhood, in their Christian faith walks, and just general mommy inspiration.

title: IN DEPTH MOM BIBLE STUDY: Church?! || Christian devotional for women
description:
Hey faithful few! 

Today's Jesus for Mommies video (my Christian mom devotionals series of bible studies) is an in depth look on our attitude/heart/struggles on going to church and as Christian moms, making it happen for our whole family. This in depth mom bible study on church is supposed to have us re-evaluate our entire thoughts surrounding going to, getting ready for, and taking part in church. This devotional technically applies to basically anyone everywhere: so whether you're a single dad needing a devotional, or a widow searching for a christian devotional for women- I hope you find this to be encouraging and that it prepares your heart for worship on Sunday. In today's Christian mom devotional, I address the idea that it can be REALLY hard for Christian moms to go to church and have to deal with all the expectations from others for their family, kids, wardrobe, etc. BUT, today I try to provide a Christian viewpoint on what we Christian moms are called to- in all reality, when it comes to church. This devotional for women is to encourage us when we feel like failures- we can't seem to arrive to church on time or with our lives together! The expectations and our failures can really weigh on us, as Christian moms. In this in depth mom bible study I talk about Isaiah 61:2-3 and our theology on the robe of righteousness and what happens on a spiritual level when we are praising and praying to our Father. And how that effects our whole viewpoint of our failures to worship perfectly, as Christian moms who have arrived late or whatever. I hope this Christian mom devotional on church encourages you and inspires you to go to church with a prepared heart this Sunday morning!

If you like Christian youtubers and could use a Christian mom youtuber in your life, consider subscribing! It's not like I am trying to be the most awesome famous Christian youtuber of 2020, but I DO want to reach mommies with God's truths and encourage other mommies with in depth mom bible studies in this challenging journey of Christian motherhood through christian mom devotionals. I love making these videos which include a sort of Christian devotional for women or devotions for moms and girls. I have been having a lot of fun making these devotional for moms videos and really think I'll move into that direction with this channel, being one  of the many female Christian youtube channels. Make sure to check out the whole Jesus for Mommies playlist, to make sure you haven't missed any of my other videos! Like this video so other Christian mommies can find this mom devotional, and I will see you in my next video!

title: CHRISTIAN MOM LIFE BALANCE || balancing it all in 2020 || balancing mom life in 2020
description:
Hey friends! As we kick off 2020 I've been thinking a lot about balance and Christian mom life balance... what that looks like to balance it all in 2020. I think we'd all say we are afraid we'll struggle balancing mom life in 2020... because mom life is crazy! But, as Christians we have truths we can hold onto and so here I TRY to provide a few key Biblical, Christian truths for us to keep in mind when we feel like we'll never achieve balance! Christian mom life balance is something admirable to pursue, for sure, but let's make sure we're not letting the world define what balance is! Whether it is work and mom life balance, because you're a working mom or stay at home mom life balance for self care and house work: we all have GOT to be on our knees asking the Lord what motherhood needs to look like in THIS season of our lives because balancing it all is going to look different in one season than the next! I pray this video gives you some food for thought in 2020 as we all pursue balance in our mom lives. I think I can really struggle with anxiety when I feel like I am not working hard enough or can't seem to manage my time, and so I hope this video is just an encouragement for moms!

title: Fast and Easy Breastfeeding/Nursing Sweatshirt Sewing Tutorial
description:

title: Newborn Cloth Diaper Stash for Baby #2 || Cloth Diapering Toddler & Newborn || Update and STASH
description:
Hey there, faithful few! Today I share with you all my lessons learned from the past 18 months of cloth diapering and my plan for cloth diapering my 2nd newborn son, due in just a few weeks! I show you the nursery, we talk potty training, one size cloth diaper stash and I walk you through my newborn cloth diaper stash as well. I watched probably too many of these videos when I was preparing for my first son, worried that I wouldn't have enough newborn cloth diapers and when it came down to it, I realized I had way too many diapers of the WRONG brand. So, moral of the story is that there's no use worrying over the newborn cloth diaper stash too much, because you never know how they will fit! Nonetheless, I share with you my plan for cloth diapering as well as the lessons I learned along the way. Cloth Diapering is definitely a process, one that's a bit fluid, changing with the phases of your child! For example, I used to hate pocket diapers, but now that I have a wiggly-worm son, I love them and can't seem to make my once-beloved-flats work. 
I hope this video benefits you in your cloth diapering journey! If it does, leave a comment down below and as always feel free to ask any questions!

title: 34 Week Pregnancy Update
description:
This is my 34 week Pregnancy Update- I can't believe I am that far in the pregnancy! After moving houses, the whooping cough catastrophe, and then the death of my sister, it has been a whirlwind! But, nonetheless, I share all the symptoms and LITTLE things that are all coming from this BIG belly of mine! I share about our life and the chaos going on and why I am having a hard time focusing on the pregnancy. I even share why we might be moving AGAIN! We talk about insomnia, varicose veins, needing to pack a hospital bag, all all the things in between! As this is my second child, it's been harder for me to be on-top of the normal to-do list that I lived by for my first pregnancy! title: Update: Pregnancy, New House and Whooping Cough!!!!
description:

My husband and 16 month old came down with whooping cough, even though my son was fully immunized and we were struggling to settle into the new house and third trimester of my pregnancy. Whooping cough is no joke! If you know anything about pertussis, or whooping cough, it is a serious cough that basically never goes away. People can cough until they throw up and even until they pass out- which is what happened with my husband.

title: DITL of a pregnant mom || Running while pregnant || day in the life of a pregnant mom
description:
This video is a day in the life of a pregnant mom video where we discuss some huge changes that are happening in the life of our family! I talk about the changes, all that it will mean for our family and process all that with y'all. I remember watching a lot of "day in the life of a pregnant mom" videos while I was pregnant with my first son, and wondering how to survive as a pregnant mom. Hope this video gives you a realistic idea of what the day to day life of a stay at home mom looks like. I also showed y'all some of our morning family run to give a better, more realistic idea of running while pregnant. I love running while pregnant and doing really any exercise while pregnant but I think there's totally a stigma around it. People think that all you can do while pregnant is sit on the couch, but that's not true! There is totally a lot of safe exercises and even running that you can do while pregnant! I love love love to run and so I have talked a lot with my doctors and they definitely approve of it. I like taking my husband along on our runs just to make me feel safer, but anyways- all I am trying to say is you can do it girl! Try running through your pregnancy and let me know how running while pregnant went! I would love to do more running vlogs if y'all have interest in that, so leave a comment down below! I think we need more moms talking realistically about running. You don't have to be a marathoner to love running! In this day in the life of a stay at home mom, we play and eat and do all the basic things of most any other family. We even stop by Walmart! Ha. Nothing special, but everything normal. I hope it is inspiring in some ways. 
I guess the only "special" thing that goes on is we discuss the big family changes that are happening and all my fears around being pregnant and moving, and packing and pregnant. Moving while pregnant will not be an easy thing, and so we talk a little about my attitude going into this. If you liked this vlog, please leave a thumbs up and comment down below! And as always, stay faithful!

title: Lost My Milk Supply! Pregnant & Breastfeeding- my son Weaned Himself 15 week Bumpdate
description:
This video is about being pregnant and breastfeeding and how/when my son weaned himself because I lost my supply. All of this is my 15 week bumpdate, part of my weekly pregnancy updates! I have had an overall great experience breastfeeding, and even breastfeeding while pregnant! So, when my son weaned himself I wasn't very happy. I was happy to keep breastfeeding during pregnancy so I was taken off guard when all of a sudden, it was done! He had weaned himself! Granted, it wasn't easy being pregnant and breastfeeding a toddler. But it was working for us! I've come to realize that I was slowly losing my milk supply because nutrients were going to the pregnancy. Low milk supply in the second trimester is something I had read about online, but I thought I would be able to tell, more! The only signs of low milk supply that I was having is my sons detaching and me having a hard time re-latching him. But, at the end of the day, I was happy that I went with baby led weaning rather than going through some hard and long process! I hope this video is informative, feel free to ask any questions you may have down below in the comments- I love making friends and helping any way I can! Thanks for watching! Subscribe, like and comment- looking forward to hearing from y'all!

Instagram: @mrsfaithwomack

title: Christian View of Depression and Anxiety || Christian Devotional || Jesus for Mommies Ep. 5?!
description:
Hey Faithful Few! Welcome back to my series of Christian Devotions for mothers, "Jesus for Mommies"- hopefully, my prayer for these video devotions is that they meet you where you're at and lead us into fellowship and conversation. Today's topic is depression and anxiety. This is a weighty topic and one that I am very closely aquatinted with, because my family and I have struggled with it. Anxiety and depression are very real issues that can feel crippling even in the Christian walk and I think it is important for us to acknowledge them and meet them with scripture. My goal is to not only provide Christian help with depression, but also start a conversation in the comments where women can encourage each other and pray for each other, bearing one another's burdens. We look at revenant and encouraging scriptures and really talk about a Christian theology of depression and try to counter many of the lies that I feel like try to hit us while we are struggling with depression and/or anxiety. Whether it is after the loss of a loved one or postpartum hormones, depression can be debilitating for mothers- I know first hand! Hopefully this video will provide some encouragement. Christian depression counseling is very important and this is to never replace that- but rather be a tool in addition to it. I want to provide some Christian, depression help. As one mom to another, or one believer to another, I pray this video helps bring some light to the darkness. 
Leave a comment down below If there is anything I can be praying for! Whether this video is two years old or not- I'll see it and I love to take a moment and stop and pray for my brothers and sisters in the faith. It not only is a blessing to me, re-grounding me throughout my day, but I hope it is a comfort for you!
Consider liking this video, so others may find it and subscribe if you want to see more content like this one! Thank you! Many blessings!

title: The Truth About Cloth Diapers... Are Cloth Diapers Worth It? || Hard? Practical? Expensive?
description:
This video is about cloth diapers and whether or not it's truly worth it to give it a try. I talk about cloth diapers in general, where to buy them, how to use them, how much they cost and compare the work load to disposables. It's important to make the decision to cloth diaper, coming in as informed as possible. And while I was preparing for my first child I looked for videos just like this one- so now, one year into cloth diapering, I share the truth: what I have learned and what I believe about cloth diapering. I talk about what makes cloth diapers hard, what makes them easy, what makes them cheap and if the cost is really worth it. I talk about ways that I tried to make cloth diapering cheaper. I hope this video gives you ideas on how you can cloth diaper on a budget, and helps you compare cloth diapers vs disposable diapers. Cloth diapering, for beginners can be overwhelming. title: Sad News from OBGYN || Adoption in our future? || Small Pelvis || C-SECTIONS ONLY
description:
This video is about some sad news that I got from my OB doc the other day and processing through the information. My doctor explained more to me about Cephalopelvic disproportion and why I shouldn't try a VBAC (vaginal birth after Caesarean section). The doctor helped explain to me that my pelvic disproportion will effect all my pregnancies and births and we would only be taking huge risks that he wouldn't suggest for even his wife if I tried a VBAC. I mourn this information and the loss of never being able to complete a normal delivery or a vaginal delivery. I talk about the limits on c-sections and how I have to plan for a second c-section. All of this is scary because of the traumatic birth I experienced and the c-section infection that resulted from that birth. I hope this video strikes up conversation about birth plans and labor, as our bodies are so strong and each woman's body and birth is beautiful. I am grateful for modern meds which saved my life and my sons life in my last birth!

More information about my first labor and delivery story:
Planned natural birth goes way wrong: https://youtu.be/Eyb6bHPTu4Q
My C-Section got Infected!: https://youtu.be/5AnM8h227is

title: CHRISTIAN MODESTY?! || Christian Modesty Christian Women Biblical Modesty
description:
Christian Modest is a hot topic and I got asked to share my thoughts on it! Ahh! Well, here we go.
I take a sort of unconventional way about this- which some people may disagree with or take fault with, which is completely fine! I'm here to give you my opinions and biblical viewpoint on Christian modesty, but I also know that not everyone will agree with me. But here are my thoughts on Christian modesty, based on my ideas of Biblical modesty. We don't have a lot spelled out in scripture about modesty, so there is definite room for debate and differences. In this series I discuss all the topics related around Christian womanhood and Christian living for moms. Hence, the name of the series, "Jesus 4 Mommies". In this particular episode, we dive into the heavy conversation of Christian modesty, as a few viewers had requested. We talk about differences in culture, body types, regions and different ideas of culture. I give a pretty broad idea about modesty because I have learned to acquire that same worldview through various places that I have lived and traveled. But, I also understand how, if someone has only lived in one place their whole life, might have a different understanding of modesty with more defined rules and lines. But I encourage Christian Women that modesty is going to be different in different places. I hope I stir up Christian discussion in love and that the community of my followers can agree in love that the cross is our ALL. It is the ONLY means of salvation, not whether or not our skirt is modest enough. So, Through our conversation over Christian dress, and modesty, I pray that we give grace and leave room for disagreements among Christian women who all view the world differently and have different climates, lifestyles, and cultures.

#modesty
#christianmodesty
#christian

title: HOW I LOST WEIGHT BEING PREGNANT|| Postpartum weight loss || working out while pregnant
description:
This video is about how I lost so much weight after my pregnancy that I ended up losing weight through the process of being pregnant! Pregnancy weight loss is a real thing! I talk about my tips and tricks to lose weight after pregnancy and how to lose that weight fast. I talk about how to loose weight during pregnancy and I talk about the numbers to my postpartum weight loss and how the weight loss journey involved hormones, everything from my sleep to my water intake to my milk production. This topic, postpartum weight loss, is a super sensitive issue but I want to give you this information on postpartum weight loss because I was looking everywhere for it just a few months ago. I talk about how breastfeeding helped me loose weight- especially pumping excess milk. I talk about how many calories are lost pumping each bottle of breast milk and how sometimes milk production is way more important than making it to the gym. Thus, how to loose weight during pregnancy and postpartum weight loss is often through the milk production. Pumping excess milk can be a great weight to kick your body into fat-burning-mode for postpartum weight loss but I caution you; don't let your milk loose its nutrition, and don't loose your milk! You are responsible for making sure your body is giving your child the nutrition he/she needs. DO NOT let your child go hungry! But, nonetheless, you can make pregnancy weight loss happen by being smart, responsible and healthy! Postpartum weight loss doesn't have to be this big mystery!

title: Rushing My Son to the Emergency Room || Amoxicillin Allergic Reaction?! ||Infant in the ER
description:
This weekend we rushed my son to the ER, for a supposed allergic reaction to amoxicillin. I wasn't completely sure what was going on but he was clearly having trouble breathing and I knew it was probably from me giving him his first dose of amoxicillin that was prescribed for an ear infection. Within ten minutes of giving him the medicine he began severely wheezing- which I had never seen him do before. Thus, we freaked out and rushed him to the hospital. Once we got to the emergency room, he was put under a bunch of testing and the doctors ruled that he was fine to go home with an inhaler and a new prescription. So glad we didn't risk anything and took him straight to the hospital because his wheezing was so scary! If you are a new parent and are not sure if your child is having an allergic reaction to amoxicillin or not- just GO TO THE HOSPITAL! 

Instagram: @mrsfaithwomack

#emergencyroom

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KR_5iK-lBJY&t=54s 





In today's video I talk about how I have been able to run and workout throughout my entire pregnancy and curb weight gain in my pregnancy. I was starting to gain too much weight in this pregnancy, and so I talk about how to loose weight while pregnant through working out while pregnant. More specifically, running while pregnant. Being a pregnant runner can be hard, specifically when there's so many misconceptions that pregnant women are just supposed to gain weight and get fat. But, I talk about how I have been able to stay a pregnant runner throughout my entire pregnancy and loose weight while pregnant or at least curb weight gain in pregnancy by running while pregnant. I hope any pregnant mommies or pregnant moms to be can find whatever information they need on how to lose weight while pregnant for a more healthy pregnancy or even to just curb pregnancy weight gain. It can be real hard to stick with a pregnancy diet, between cravings and morning sickness, so that's why I feel it is so important for more pregnant moms to know just how important and helpful working out in pregnancy can be! title: Pregnant Right After Miscarriage!!!!!
description:
I apologize for the poor video quality, but hope this video encourages any women who have suffered with miscarriages and are asking questions. I had a chemical pregnancy and then found out literally one month later that I was pregnant! In this video I discuss how it happened, my feelings around the miscarriage and the pregnancy as well as probably way too many details about our trying to conceive (ttc) journey. From DPO (days past ovulation) to the miscarriage and my cycle regulating I hope my story can be helpful and encouraging to anyone in a similar boat. 
Instagram: @mrsfaithwomack



https://www.patreon.com/howtofaithalife

title: Chemical Pregnancies and Christian Faith, Christians TTC, InFertility, Faith, Pregnancy
description: This video is a raw response and prayerful processing on a chemical pregnancy. How I mourned an EARLY miscarriage and kept the faith.

title: Infertility & TTC, a Christian Faith perspective, light lines and test strips
description: This video is for the encouragement of other believers who may also be trying to conceive and are tempted to start feeling hopeless or alone. Hopefully my story will be encouraging and uplifting!

title: Christian Trying to Conceive, TTC Fertility and Faith, Infertility, Negative Test
description:
This is a video to connect with other Christian women who are also emotionally struggling through their desires to conceive and " be fruitful and multiply". This video is just a conversation starter- comment below with your reactions and truths you hold onto as a Christian woman wanting a baby but struggling with infertility or a hard start.

Go ahead and subscribe to follow the journey the Lord has in store here!
